page.title: 10TRANSPORT AND TRADE
page.content: {Specific Survey:}Many people travel by bus.Single level buses carry about 60 passengers, while double deckers carry nearly 100 people.Green buses with orange stripes are run by Crosville Motor Services, and red and cream ones are operated by Halton Transport.The main bus station joins Runcorn to the local towns of Widnes,Northwich, Frodsham and Warrington.Express services link the town with Liverpool Chester,Manchester,Blackpool,London, Birmingham and N.Wales.Major roads link Runcorn to the rest of Britain. Locals use them to get to and from the Shopping City.While there shoppers leave their cars in multi_storey car parks.You can walk about town along footpaths and ride a bicycle along one of the new cycleways.Horse riding is allowed on bridle paths in Town Park.
